definitions.definition: The power or faculty of performing such operations; especially, when unqualified, the faculty of judging or deciding rightly, justly, or wisely.
examples: a man of judgment / a man of good judgment

definitions.definition: The conclusion or result of judging; an opinion ; a decision .
The act of determining, as in courts of law, what is conformable to law and justice; also, the determination , decision , or sentence of a court, or of a judge.
The final award ; the last sentence .

secondary_definitions: The power or faculty of performing such operations; especially, when unqualified, the faculty of judging or deciding rightly, justly, or wisely.
The conclusion or result of judging; an opinion ; a decision .
( law ) The act of determining, as in courts of law, what is conformable to law and justice; also, the determination , decision , or sentence of a court, or of a judge.
( theology ) The final award ; the last sentence .
